column4: can anyone tell this newbie how to configure gnome to be able to drag/drop files from one folder to another?
using a mouse?
that is enabled by default
for some reason i don't have the permission to do that
you can't drag files into folders outside your home directory
what error do you get?
thats not your home directory
you to use sudo, but why do you need to copy something to that directory?
you'll either need to run nautilus via sudo or use the command line to copy it via suod
can you tell me how to run nautilus via sudo?
open a terminal and type sudo nautilus
I typed "sudo nautilus" and then my password in terminal, but still get the same error
you need to copy using only the window that opens when you run that command
was there supposed to be a window that automatically opens with that command?  I didn't ge any...
try gksudo nautilus
don't paste in here
its easier to just use the command line; sudo cp yourfile /usr/local/bin
installer for what?
i mounted Matlab iso's into my filesystem, and I am trying to run the installer
thanks for helping
I'd bet there are installation instructions on the CD
